name: BlueBay Grand Esmeralda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Bluebay Grand Esmeralda is one of the best value deals in Riviera Maya. The resort might not be the best out there but the cost benefit is great.
reviews.title: Very good value in Riviera Maya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled with our two kids, a 2 year-old and a 4 year-old and had a great time. Check-in and check-out were quick and efficient.
reviews.title: Good solid hotel don't believe BAD reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms are not large. We got a standard room with resort view. As the name says it was standard. Not bad, not good. Everything worked though. The view was not good but we knew it wouldn't be anyway. Room service was okay. The folks at receptions always responded to any requests on a timely manner.
reviews.title: a grand vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff in general was good. Not excellent at some times. But most of the staff was helpful and attentive. As most resorts in that area, they tried to push a time share deal on us. We lost a whole morning on that. But it was worth it, as they gave us a $250 resort credit for that. The credit is valid for the spa and other activities or products that you can buy at the resort. I used it for scuba diving. By the way, they offer scuba diving leaving from the hotel beach. The boat leaves twice a day. It wasn't the best dive ever but was pretty decent, the water wasn't too clear that day. I was able to see a descent size sea turtle at least.
reviews.title: Great service and facilities..........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants were very good and the buffets had lots of options. Since the weather wasn't that great while we were there, we spent a lot of time eating. No complaints about their food. Services was sometimes slow.
reviews.title: Customer Service Needs Improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this resort for our honeymoon - read plenty of reviews online, and needless to say I wasn't expecting tons out of the resort. In that aspect, it exceeded my expectations.
reviews.title: Great Value!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a decent ride down from the airport - next time I think we will stay closer. Good distance to Playa Del Carmen though. I have to say I like Puerto Vallarta better as a town with shopping and things. Still good to visit for a day or two.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT HOTEL AND GREAT STAFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort itself is very nice looking. I was going to ask for a honeymoon upgrade, but didn't need to, as they had already upgraded us to a swim-up suite for free. Our room was in one of the buildings closest to the ocean/beach/pool. It's true, the resort is very spread out/large. My wife and I liked it because we enjoy walking. But if you were older or didn't like to/couldn't walk much, this is not the place for you. We enjoyed the fresh air and exercise on the way to and from dinner, shows, etc. There is also a grouping of buildings set off from the lobby/shops. They had their own pool and food, but were located a long way from the ocean/beach. At least a 10 minute walk. (They did have shuttles, seemed to be a little sparse but if you waited 5-10 minutes you'd get one.)
reviews.title: A Week in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My suggestion would be to insist on a beachside room. However, those tend to be louder because of the pool music, etc.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool is HUGE. There was ALWAYS room, under the awnings, in the shallows, or on the beach under the cabanas. I've dealt with full pools/beaches before, so this was nice.
reviews.title: DO NOT GO!!!!!!!!!! PLEASE READ ALL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a last minute vacation to BBGE in a garden view room. We were in Building 6, a fairly long walk to the main pool/beach, but we actually loved the location. We ate and drank so much (Great food/drinks) that we were glad to be able to walk some of the calories off! The room was also located close to the lobby, sports bar, specialty restaurants, gym, tennis courts and gift shops. There is also another pool with bar and food service at this end of the resort for anyone who does not want to walk to the main pool/beach area every time.
reviews.title: BBGE - Awesome, relaxing vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The resort grounds and room were kept meticulously clean. There was always ground crew/cleaning staff around working. The only place we felt that could have used more staffing was at the bars. They do offer table/beach/pool service by a wait staff, but that was not always the fastest in service. When going to the bars to request our own drinks, we frequently had to wait longer than we felt we should have as the bartenders were busy filling the wait staff orders as well as the guests at the bar. They seemed to have 2 bartenders at many of the bars, occasionally 3. If they kept 3, service would be so much better. That being said, the drinks were great, you could ask for specific brands of alcohol, and if you had a bubba keg they gladly filled it. Also, the staff was friendly and always willing to make a new drink if we requested them.
reviews.title: Great place for all travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The specialty restaurants were amazing! We did book by 9 am daily for the next day's meals and were able to get into all 6 themes. Each theme night had food we were highly impressed with and the staff was very attentive to us at each of these meals. The choices at the restaurants and the buffets were varied enought that we felt there were choices for everyone. We love breakfast and have to say each of the 3 buffet locations provided us with many choices, with the main dishes being the same and a few of the "sides" varying from location to location. We always had lunch at the pool restaurant and found it to be plentiful, but nothing spectacular, just the normal foods such as burgers, hot dogs, pizza, chicken, salad, etc. However, if you wanted to wait for a cook to order main dish, including steak, it was available. We only had dinner at the buffet one night at their oriental theme night. Again, we found the selections to be plentiful and tasty. They even had lots of fresh sushi which was delicious. Desserts were excellent all the meals!
reviews.title: BBGE November 2010

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach and main pool area were clean and beautiful. The only thing I have to agree with other reviewers was the fact that when you walked a certain path to the pool there was a very strong septic-like smell. The down side to some of the rooms closest to the beach would be this smell; once at the pool, though, we did not notice this smell anymore. (Another reason we liked to location of our room). The pool and beach had enough chairs throughout the day. We spent most of the time on the beach and loved the many palm trees with chairs under them so we could take advantage of shade as well as sun. Again, we never had a problem finding chairs. The swing bar at the beach was a nice touch and we were always able to get a swing when we wanted them!
reviews.title: The Good and Bad - Review from our Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We used Apple Vacations and their reps did meet with us once to tell us about various excursions that were available to purchase through them. We have been in the area several times and planned on just relaxing this trip and only wanted to go into Playa del Carmen for an outing. They were not pushy at all when we told them this and were helpful to tell us about the hotel shuttle that takes you to/from town at certain times during the day. This option was less expensive than an individual taxi and worked out for our schedule. You did not need reservations for the shuttle and could take it one way and take a taxi the other way if that fit your schedule better.
reviews.title: Nothing Spectacular, didn't stay here by choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have travelled in several allinclusive locations like Dominican republic, Aruba, Egypt, India, Thailand and so on. In many cases the all inclusive system makes You feel like the hotel is trying to save as much money at Your cost as possible - like having very small glasses and unappetizing food in restaurants or only a few bartenders to serve tons of customers at bars and so on. In Bluebay Grand Esmeralda there was no feeling of stretching pennies anywhere and we were very pleased with the food and drinks quality and variety with varying different food themes like mexcican, italian, japanese and so on every day (also several exccelent restaurants to choose from). The staff was really friendly, helpful and there was always enough staff despite quite a full hotel because of the climate meeting in Cancun.
reviews.title: I've been around - this is #1 all inclusive at this price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel pool area is spacious and good for adults and toddlers but there could be more variety of fifferent depths for a bit more advanced kidswimmers. The sea beach/water was somewhat dirty of seaweed and debris from sea despite the daily cleaning efforts made by hotelstaff - perhaps its cleaner and clearer at other times of year?
reviews.title: Perfect Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff was really helpful with everything we threw at them.. Hotelgrounds and our room were tidy, wellkept and clean (ok we saw a couple of cocroaches at hotel area in two weeks time - but there are those everywhere where food is processed and humans live in Mexico) grounds were fumigated at least once a week.
reviews.title: Beautiful! Perfect family resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I sincerely recommend this hotel - It exceeded my expectations for this amount of money.... sure You can find same level or better hotels in Cancun / Playa del carmen area, but at this price? I doubt it...
reviews.title: Service not typical of a Mexican Destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010
reviews.text: I am not sure why there are some negative reviews here. Maybe it is that you just can't please everyone. My boyfriend and I had a super time. The staff bend over backwards to make sure you have everything you want and do it all with a smile! Rooms are great, pool is beautiful! Never an empty drink in your hand:) The beach does have some sediment in the water but it is still a great spot. If you walk down a few resorts there is a crystal clear river that runs in to the ocean. Lots of great fish to see and a great place for a swim! Food was excellent! No issues making reservations and we even changed a couple without problems. Italian and Steak restaurants were my top choice but all food was good. Victor at the front desk was super friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Would not return to Mexico as a result of this resort

description: Ideally located in an area of 445 acres in a prime position on the beach on the Riviera Maya, BlueBay Grand Esmeralda combines elegant Mayan features with contemporary design and a wide range of service to suit the most discerning traveller. BlueBay Grand Esmeralda provides a relaxed atmosphere for holiday makers. The Hotel features 979 elegant and well-appointed rooms and suites with the option of a sea or garden view.
